verb.description: To shout or cry yoick!. Also with object: to encourage or urge on (a hound) by crying yoick!.

exclamation.description: A call or cry used to urge on hounds.

noun.description: A cry or exclamation of yoick!.

origin: Early 19th century; earliest use found in John Bernard (1756–1828), actor and theatre manager. From yoick<br>late 18th century; earliest use found in Polite Singer. Imitative.
